entry.title: UN Security Council holds emergency talks on Karabakh blockade

media:group.media:title: UN Security Council holds emergency talks on Karabakh blockade
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe United Nations Security Council has so far not issued a statement or resolution after emergency talks yesterday on Azerbaijan‚Äôs ongoing blockade of Karabakh. üìçProtesters gathered in front of the UN Armenia office to urge the organization to take action to address the humanitarian crisis unfolding in Karabakh. üìçAn Armenian soldier was detained by Azerbaijani troops after appearing in Azerbaijani territory in still-unclear circumstances. The soldier‚Äôs current whereabouts is unknown.

entry.title: Discussing Armenia‚Äôs development opportunities with Mary Papazian

media:group.media:title: Discussing Armenia‚Äôs development opportunities with Mary Papazian
media:group.media:description:
Aram Pakchanyan, the host of CivilNet‚Äôs Ark of Education program, sat down with Mary Papazian, former president of San Jose State University, to discuss Armenia‚Äôs development opportunities.
This conversation was recorded on the sidelines of the Armenian Society of Fellows conference in Dilijan, Armenia in June 2023. Mary Papazian is an ASOF cofounder.

entry.title: Karabakh reports first starvation death amid blockade

media:group.media:title: Karabakh reports first starvation death amid blockade
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe authorities in Karabakh reported the first case of a person dying from hunger amid Azerbaijan‚Äôs more than eight-month blockade of the region. üìçAhead of emergency UN talks on Karabakh, Armenia‚Äôs foreign minister phoned his counterpart in Paris, while Azerbaijan‚Äôs top diplomat called his counterpart in Moscow. üìçMore than 100 leading public intellectuals in Israel and Turkey, two of Azerbaijan‚Äôs major arms suppliers, signed on to separate open letters urging an end to the blockade.

entry.title: Children Away From Home: Citizens protest in front of UN Armenia Office

media:group.media:title: Children Away From Home: Citizens protest in front of UN Armenia Office
media:group.media:description:
Protestors gathered on the streets in front of the UN Armenia Office on Wednesday to raise their voices against the 8-month-long blockade of the Lachin Corridor, a vital lifeline for the people of Artsakh. Under the banner of ‚ÄúChildren Away From Home,‚Äù individuals in Yerevan are demanding urgent action to address the dire humanitarian crisis unfolding in Nagorno Karabakh. This event took place as an emergency UN Security Council meeting was set to convene later that day regarding the situation in Artsakh. CivilNet spoke with those present to understand more. #CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #artsakhunderblockade
